alert.note: Alert for Northwest Plateau; West Central Mountains (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued September 30 at 1:51AM MDT until September 30 at 7:00PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 1 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 7 PM MDT THIS EVENING FOR THE NORTHWEST PLATEAU AND WEST CENTRAL MOUNTAINS DUE TO STRONG WINDS, LOW HUMIDITY AND AN UNSTABLE AIR MASS... .An upper trough deepening over the Great Basin will spread strong winds and dry, unstable air over portions of western New Mexico today, especially along and west of the Continental Divide. Above normal warmth will also continue today. While humidities increase later this evening, stronger winds at mountain top levels will linger tonight through Sunday. ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 1 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 7 PM MDT THIS EVENING... The National Weather Service in Albuquerque has issued a Red Flag Warning...which is in effect from 1 PM this afternoon to 7 PM MDT this evening. * AREA AND TIMING...Northwest Plateau (Zone 101) and West Central Mountains (Zone 105) from early this afternoon through early this evening, especially along and west of the Continental Divide. * 20 FOOT WINDS...South to southwest 20 to 30 mph with gusts to around 40 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...Ranging from 10 to 15 percent. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Red Flag Warning.
